info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Berks and north central Chester Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Churchtown, or 7 miles northeast of New Holland, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pottstown, Birdsboro, Honey Brook, Elverson, New Morgan, Glenmoore, Pughtown, Lionville, Cedarville, Lionville-Marchwood, Stowe, South Pottstown, Amity Gardens, Kenilworth, Halfway House and Exton. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 296 and 313. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
